result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell D. Hundt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Ordered joint and several with co-defendants and to be paid within first 3 months of supervision.

Court costs due during period of supervision.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant to submit to random testing
No contact with co-defendants: Joseph Detroye; Travis Diels; Mark Wollenzien
Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.
Defendant to submit to random testing
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment

Defendant Mitchell D. Hundt in court with attorney Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts said plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.
